title: Most $q$-matroids are not representable
abstract:
A $q$-matroid is the analogue of a matroid which arises by replacing the
finite ground set of a matroid with a finite-dimensional vector space over a
finite field. These $q$-matroids are motivated by coding theory as the
representable $q$-matroids are the ones that stem from rank-metric codes. In
this note, we establish a $q$-analogue of Nelson's theorem in matroid theory by
proving that asymptotically almost all $q$-matroids are not representable. This
answers a question about representable $q$-matroids by Jurrius and Pellikaan
strongly in the negative.
